verses.kjv: This second epistle, beloved, I now write unto you; in both which I stir up your pure minds by way of remembrance:
verses.ct: Dear friends, this is now my 2nd letter to you. In both of them, I've been trying to refresh your sincere thinking through these reminders,

verses.kjv: That ye may be mindful of the words which were spoken before by the holy prophets, and of the commandment of us the apostles of the Lord and Saviour:
verses.ct: so that you'll remember what the holy prophets said long ago, as well as the command that our Lord and Savior gave through us, his apostles.

verses.kjv: Knowing this first, that there shall come in the last days scoffers, walking after their own lusts,
verses.ct: Above all, understand this: in the final days, mockers will show up who live according to their own desires.

verses.kjv: And saying, Where is the promise of his coming? for since the fathers fell asleep, all things continue as they were from the beginning of the creation.
verses.ct: They'll say, 'What happened to his promised return? Ever since our ancestors died, everything has stayed exactly the same as it was since the beginning of creation.'

verses.kjv: For this they willingly are ignorant of, that by the word of God the heavens were of old, and the earth standing out of the water and in the water:
verses.ct: They deliberately ignore the fact that long ago the heavens existed and the earth was formed out of water and by means of water through God's word.

verses.kjv: Whereby the world that then was, being overflowed with water, perished:
verses.ct: Through these same waters, the world of that time was flooded and destroyed.

verses.kjv: But the heavens and the earth, which are now, by the same word are kept in store, reserved unto fire against the day of judgment and perdition of ungodly men.
verses.ct: But by that same word, the present heavens and earth are being held in reserve for fire, kept for the day of judgment and the destruction of ungodly people.

verses.kjv: But, beloved, be not ignorant of this one thing, that one day is with the Lord as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.
verses.ct: But don't overlook this one fact, dear friends: to the Lord, a single day is like 1,000 years, and 1,000 years are like a single day.

verses.kjv: The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.
verses.ct: The Lord isn't slow about keeping his promise the way some people define slowness. Instead, he is patient with you, not wanting anyone to be destroyed but wanting everyone to turn back to him in repentance.

verses.kjv: But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night; in the which the heavens shall pass away with a great noise, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat, the earth also and the works that are therein shall be burned up.
verses.ct: But the day of the Lord will arrive like a thief. On that day, the heavens will disappear with a tremendous roar, the basic elements will be consumed by intense heat, and the earth along with everything done on it will be burned up.

verses.kjv: Seeing then that all these things shall be dissolved, what manner of persons ought ye to be in all holy conversation and godliness,
verses.ct: Since all of these things are going to be destroyed in this way, think about what kind of people you should be — living in holiness and godly devotion,

verses.kjv: Looking for and hasting unto the coming of the day of God, wherein the heavens being on fire shall be dissolved, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat?
verses.ct: eagerly waiting for and working toward the arrival of God's day, when the heavens will be set ablaze and destroyed and the elements will melt in intense heat.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless we, according to his promise, look for new heavens and a new earth, wherein dwelleth righteousness.
verses.ct: But based on his promise, we are waiting for new heavens and a new earth where righteousness is at home.

verses.kjv: Wherefore, beloved, seeing that ye look for such things, be diligent that ye may be found of him in peace, without spot, and blameless.
verses.ct: So then, dear friends, since you are waiting for these things, make every effort to be found by him living in peace, without stain, and free from blame.

verses.kjv: And account that the longsuffering of our Lord is salvation; even as our beloved brother Paul also according to the wisdom given unto him hath written unto you;
verses.ct: Recognize that our Lord's patience means salvation — just as our dear brother Paul also wrote to you with the wisdom God gave him.

verses.kjv: As also in all his epistles, speaking in them of these things; in which are some things hard to be understood, which they that are unlearned and unstable wrest, as they do also the other scriptures, unto their own destruction.
verses.ct: He speaks about these matters in all of his letters. Some parts of them are difficult to grasp, and ignorant and unstable people twist those passages — just as they twist the rest of the Scriptures — leading to their own destruction.

verses.kjv: Ye therefore, beloved, seeing ye know these things before, beware lest ye also, being led away with the error of the wicked, fall from your own stedfastness.
verses.ct: So then, dear friends, since you already know about this in advance, stay on guard so that you aren't carried away by the deception of lawless people and lose your firm standing.

verses.kjv: But grow in grace, and in the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. To him be glory both now and for ever. Amen.
verses.ct: Instead, keep growing in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. All glory belongs to him, both now and into eternity. Amen.
